title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
So this mac had no display at all.
Had a nest of insect garbage under board below cpu.

suspecting lid closed issue discovered R5075 for smc_lid was corroded and replaced along with C4920 and c4904 which were also corroded and coming off board.

NOw I get backlight (no image) and keyboard until boot. I can do pram for 1 chime then I believe the keyboard is turning off and after boot no keyboard or trackpad again.

What in boot cycle would kick on that might supercede keyboard and controller? I reflowed the SMC also. Also noticed if I leave the external display kicked in with lid open it doesn't turn the backlight or display on at all.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Check BUTTON_DISABLE level.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: u5701 pin 53 lid open =0V

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Try changing U5701.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: CHanged out U5701. Get display not sure related to the U5701 but progress... Still no keyboard or trackpad. I don't think I was gettting any keyboard action prior looking back. I think I happened to have a smc lid issue AND apparently also a keyboard/tp issue.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: anything else keyboard TP related under CPU? near R5075. That was the messiest also area under speaker

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
Try again known good trackpad flex/board.
Check resistors around U5701 and its power rails.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: SHould I have voltage at U5805 without keyboard/tp connected? I have 5V at pin 2 and nothing at the rest... I did try replacing U5805 already.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
U5805 is enabled by trackpad presence.

Does the tracpad click work?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
No click either. SMC reset works so there's definitely proper connection there but as soon as I hit the power button the keyboard must turn off, it won't do PRAM reset or go to bootable drive selection screen with option key hold, etc...

I do get proper 3.3V at two points of u5701 and at 3.42V and 3.3V on tpad and kb connectors appropriately. 18.5V with cables plugged in at pin 21 j5800

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Did you pick U5701 from donor board, same model?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: yes I can try one more time but to get same results seems pretty odd

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Do you still have 0V at pin 53 of U5701?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
Circling back to some of my older projects again...
Yes, 0V at pin 53 with kb and tp connected. 
Power button works before and after boot. I tried changing the firmware chip for entertainment. NO changes regardelss of anything I've tried. Moved it to completely different TP/KB and nada. I was able to do PRAM reset with external but can't detect keys are registering other than the power key.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
PRAM reset, also SMC reset, are done by hardware; corresponding keys go directly to specific chip (U5750).
For normal use, keyboard information (trackpad too), is decoded into U5701 and sent to PCH via USB.
You may have a problem with U2700 (USB Hub); check its area.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: swapped out U2700 and tried swapping u5701 again to no avail. THinking I should just toss it into the parts bin unless you have any thoughts. I checked traces from keyboard to u5701 to u2700. I don't get it. PCH?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
Bluetooth works?
If not, the problem is on U2700 area...

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
My external keyboard quit working. NOt sure if something with this machine caused that? The mouse hooked to keyboard still works. Using wireless w USB works. Maybe it just coincidentally quit.

No bluetooth.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Bluetooth is connected through U2700 too; so there is the problem...

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
Swapped out u2700 once. Traces from that to???
Does USB data channel a different route than u2700?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
Check its voltages, traces, solders.
J4700 works at least?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: I'm lost with this board. Now I have no 18.5V at tracpad connector J5800. no Z2_Boost_EN WITH trackpad connected (tried multiple AND new j5800 just out of desperation). Does keyboard ALSO need to be connected? I have 3V3_S4 at J5800. Something must not be getting to J5800 for it to send 3.3V to Z2_Boost_EN?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
TP is independent, no need to connect KB.
Did you try known good TP and flex?
Check your job on U2700; resolder original U5701 and U2700.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Yes J4700 works. I was able to get 18.5V back at j5800. I'll check voltage again TO U2700 but if that's ok i assume its a trace from U2700 to next stop but not sure what the data output pins are on U2700 OR it looks like USB may also come through U2700?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message:
J4700 port do not pass through U2700.
Seems that you have a problem with U2700, or its communication with PCH.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Best I can tell it has to be PCH. Could I run jumpers to send data through USB? or different route to test or maybe as alternative to junking the board?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Try running U5701 through J4700 port lines.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: U5701pin 20/21 to  J4700 pin 3/2? is that all that would need to be done to replicate?

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Yes, but remove R5701/02 to open connection lines with U2700.

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: No change. I MUST have an issue with U5701 then, correct? I've tried other tracks and keyboards... tried completely different top case, etc... as well as I think this was the 3rd U5701!

title: 820-3115 backlight, no display, no keyboard no trackpad, external display good
message: Nope. No change. Replaced keyboard connector. THis board is driving me crazy.
